reviews.title: Relais Grand Tour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a perfect place for us to stay in Florence as we celebrated our 30th anniversary! Cristina and Guiseppe were very gracious hosts, making all of our museum and restaurant reservations for us, giving us excellent tips for dining, as well as directions for everywhere we wanted to go in Florence. The B/B is wonderfully situated in the historic district, though there was never any noise, traffic or problems. We would visit the sites in the morning, eat lunch, run back to the hotel for a quick afternoon nap and be ready to go again for the evening. These were among the nicest people we met, as well as the most comfortable hotel we stayed in on our trip. Computer and Internet came as part of the room. We visited in June, 2006 and stayed in the Mirror Suite. A return visit is a definite!
reviews.title: Wonderful hosts, perfect location

reviews.text: I stayed in the Diva suite, which is off a semi-private courtyard with beautiful flowers and a nice little bistro table. The room was great- lots of antiques, ceramic tile, and comfortable beds. The room was very quiet and private, despite the entrance off the shared courtyard. Breakfasts were provided via a coupon for the little bistro/cafe on the corner, which at first struck me as being somewhat inconvenient, but once I tried it, I felt like a local! And the food was good, which helps! After breakfast, all the major sites are a short walk away.
reviews.title: Sweet little B&B...once you find it!

reviews.title: A wonderful place to spend our 25th wedding anniversary!
reviews.text: Ok, the one and only negative- it's a bit hard to find. The street sign for Via Reparata is about 20 or 30 feet off the ground, mounted on the side of a building, which you can't see if you're coming from the train station. Once you finally find the street, finding the hotel is also a bit of a problem, since there is no big sign saying, "Relais Grand Tour". Instead, the only indication of its existence is a small brass nameplate by the buzzer. So to help you make your stay here completely perfect, here's the secret: if you're coming from the train station (Novella) you'll turn left onto Via Reparata and the Relais is about halfway down the block on the lefthand side of the street. Just read the nameplates on the buzzers and you should have no problems!

description: A quiet flowered patio, 3 romantic suites and 2 double rooms, this is Relais Grand Tour, located in a quiet street into the historic center close to the Academy Gallery and the Duomo sq. Owners on site. All rooms have free wi-fi, in-room basic breakfast facilities, air con./heating. Uffizi Gallery is within 15 minutes walk.
